introduction: Is making new ‘mum friends’ the positive experience it’s often described as? For audio, transcript a

vocabulary.definition: a small group of people who spend a lot of time together and may seem unfriendly towards others
vocabulary.example: At the school gates, there's a clique of sporty mums and another clique of glam mums.

vocabulary.definition: short for glamorous, meaning visually attractive and exciting
vocabulary.example: The glam mums at the school always dress up and wear makeup.

vocabulary.definition: to belong and feel accepted by a group of people because you are similar to them
vocabulary.example: She struggled to fit in with the sporty mums clique at her child's school.

vocabulary.definition: depending on chance or luck rather than any skill or effort
vocabulary.example: Meeting new friends can be down to luck, sometimes you just click with someone.

vocabulary.definition: to feel a friendly and positive connection when meeting someone for the first time
vocabulary.example: I instantly clicked with my new neighbor, we became friends right away.

vocabulary.definition: an arrangement that parents make for their young children to play together
vocabulary.example: They organized a play date for their kids to meet and play together at the park.
